messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: A civilisation is many people who live together.
They make art, rules and towns.
A language is words and sounds people use to talk.
Between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago, people drew pictures on rock walls.
This is early evidence of human civilisation.
We do not know why art and language appear together.
Brains did not suddenly get bigger.
But people did more things and became more intelligent.
Did using language make their brains develop?
Or did more intelligent brains start language?
Feedback received: Grade 2/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL: Factual Inaccuracy. The writer’s output adds new content not in the original. For example, the original never states “A civilisation is many people who live together. They make art, rules and towns.” This definition is invented and alters the core message.

Language is words and sounds people use to talk.  
Between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago, people drew on cave walls.  
This is early evidence of human civilisation.  
We do not know why art and language appear together.  
Brains did not suddenly get bigger.  
But people became more complex and more intelligent.  
Did using language make their brains develop?  
Or did more intelligent brains start language?
Feedback received: Grade 4/10 - FAIL

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: We see early human civilisation between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago.  
Though, we see it through paintings on rock walls, for example.  
No one knows what this has to do with language.  
Brains did not suddenly get bigger.  
But humans became more intelligent.  
Did using language make our brains change?  
Or did our changed brains make language?
Feedback received: Grade 4/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text:
FAIL: CEFR Compliance Failure. The CEFR classifier rated the text as B1, not A2.
1. The B1-level word 'though' appears in sentence 2, violating A2 vocabulary restrictions.
2. A2 connectors must be limited to and, but, so, because, but you used 'though'.
Suggestion: Remove or replace 'though' with 'but' to meet A2 standards.

Text saved: Between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago, though, we see early civilisation with cave paintings; no one knows the link with language.  
Civilisation is when people live together.  
A cave painting is art on cave walls.  
Language is how we use words to talk.  
Brains did not suddenly get bigger, but humans got more complex and more intelligent.  
Did using language make our brains change?  
Or did our more complex and more intelligent brains start language?
Feedback received: Grade 3/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL: CEFR Compliance. Classifier rated B1. Evidence: The sentence “Between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago, though, we see early civilisation with cave paintings;” uses the B1-level connector “though.” The words “cave” and “complex” are classified as B1. A2 must only use simple connectors and A2 vocabulary. Suggestion: Remove “though” and start with “But we see.” Replace “cave” with “rock” in “rock painting.” Replace “complex” with “detailed.” Limit connectors to and, but, so, because. messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: Civilisation is when people live in groups with rules and art.  
Language is the words people use to talk to each other.  
Between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago people made cave paintings.  
We see these paintings today.  
They are evidence of early human civilisation.  
No one knows the connection between these paintings and language.  
Brains did not suddenly get bigger.  
Yet people became more complex and more intelligent.  
Was it using language that made their brains grow?  
Or did their more complex brains start to make language?
Feedback received: Grade 3/10 - FAIL
